subject: Mental Health
title: The Amygdala Alarm System
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Amygdala Alarm System.

hook.text: Deep inside your brain sits an almond-shaped structure that controls your fear.

buildup.text: The amygdala scans for threats constantly, even while you sleep.

discovery.text: It fires before the rational brain can evaluate the situation.

twist.text: In people with anxiety, the amygdala is hyperactive â€” it sees danger everywhere.

climax.text: Brain imaging shows anxious people have larger, more reactive amygdalae.

punchline.text: The alarm works. It just won't shut off.
